{"step_by_step_thinking": "tRNA is responsible for bringing amino acids to the ribosome during protein synthesis, not for binding mRNA to the ribosome. 7 methyl guanosine capping and Poly A tail are both features of mRNA in eukaryotes, not prokaryotes. The Shine Dalgarno sequence, on the other hand, is a ribosomal binding site in prokaryotic mRNA, to which the ribosome binds at the start of translation.", "answer_choice": "B"}
